intro: Ixora versteegii, commonly known as the Cape rose or red ixora, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of bright red, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 3 meters, with simple, opposite leaves. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular ornamental plant in gardens. Ixora versteegii is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as birds and bees.
